# CLBeaconRegion

**Class**

A region for detecting the presence of iBeacon devices.

## Declaration

```swift
class CLBeaconRegion
```

## Overview

A [doc://com.apple.corelocation/documentation/CoreLocation/CLBeaconRegion] object defines a region that you use to detect Bluetooth beacons conforming to the iBeacon specification. In contrast to a [doc://com.apple.corelocation/documentation/CoreLocation/CLCircularRegion] that centers on a geographic location, a [doc://com.apple.corelocation/documentation/CoreLocation/CLBeaconRegion] focuses on an iBeacon with specific identifying characteristics, which you provide. When a matching device comes in range, Core Location notifies your app.

You monitor beacon regions in two ways. To detect when a beacon is in range, use the [doc://com.apple.corelocation/documentation/CoreLocation/CLLocationManager/startMonitoring(for:)] method of your location manager object. After detecting a beacon, call the [doc://com.apple.corelocation/documentation/CoreLocation/CLLocationManager/startRangingBeacons(in:)] method to determine the relative distance to that beacon.

When detecting an iBeacon, you need to specify the [doc://com.apple.corelocation/documentation/CoreLocation/CLBeaconRegion/proximityUUID], [doc://com.apple.corelocation/documentation/CoreLocation/CLBeaconRegion/major], and [doc://com.apple.corelocation/documentation/CoreLocation/CLBeaconRegion/minor] values that you programmed into the beacon hardware. You use the values to identify your beacons uniquely, and you can specify a subset of values to detect multiple beacons. The [doc://com.apple.corelocation/documentation/CoreLocation/CLBeaconRegion/proximityUUID] property is typically the same for all of the beacons in your installation. Use the [doc://com.apple.corelocation/documentation/CoreLocation/CLBeaconRegion/major] and [doc://com.apple.corelocation/documentation/CoreLocation/CLBeaconRegion/minor] values to distinguish among different beacons in your installation.

If you want to configure the current iOS device as a Bluetooth beacon, create a beacon region with the appropriate identifying information. You can then call the [doc://com.apple.corelocation/documentation/CoreLocation/CLBeaconRegion/peripheralData(withMeasuredPower:)] method of the region to get a dictionary that you can use to advertise the device with the Core Bluetooth framework. For more information about using that framework to advertise the device as a beacon, see [doc://com.apple.corelocation/documentation/CoreLocation/turning-an-ios-device-into-an-ibeacon-device].

For information about how to detect beacons, see [doc://com.apple.corelocation/documentation/CoreLocation/determining-the-proximity-to-an-ibeacon-device].

## Creating a beacon region

- **init(beaconIdentityConstraint:identifier:)**: Creates and returns a region object that targets beacons that satisfy the specified beacon identity constraints.
- **init(uuid:identifier:)**: Creates and returns a region object that targets beacons with the specified UUID.
- **init(uuid:major:identifier:)**: Creates and returns a region object that targets beacons with the specified UUID and major value.
- **init(uuid:major:minor:identifier:)**: Creates and returns a region object that targets beacons with the specified UUID, and major and minor values.
- **CLBeaconMajorValue**: The most significant value in a beacon.
- **CLBeaconMinorValue**: The least significant value in a beacon.

## Getting the beacon identity

- **uuid**: The UUID value from the beacon identity constraint that defines the beacon region.
- **major**: The major value from the beacon identity constraint that defines the beacon region.
- **minor**: The minor value from the beacon identity constraint that defines the beacon region.
- **beaconIdentityConstraint**: The beacon identity constraint that defines the beacon region.

## Specifying when to send notifications

- **notifyEntryStateOnDisplay**: A Boolean value that indicates whether Core Location sends beacon notifications when the device’s display is on.

## Getting the beacon’s advertisement data

- **peripheralData(withMeasuredPower:)**: Retrieves data that you can use to advertise the current device as a beacon.

## Deprecated

- **init(proximityUUID:identifier:)**: Creates and returns a region object that targets a beacon with the specified UUID.
- **init(proximityUUID:major:identifier:)**: Creates and returns a region object that targets a beacon with the specified proximity ID and major value.
- **init(proximityUUID:major:minor:identifier:)**: Creates and returns a region object that targets a beacon with the specified proximity ID, major value, and minor value.
- **proximityUUID**: The unique ID of the beacons you’re targeting.

## Classes

- **CLBeaconIdentityConstraint**: Identity characteristics that can match one or more beacons.
- **CLCircularRegion**: A circular geographic region that a center point and radius deine.

## Inherits From

- CLRegion
